attributes.action: Drop plans for the warrantless monitoring and logging of all electronic communications
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Communications Capabilities Development Program, the government seeks to order internet service providers and other communications companies to store detailed logs of calls, text messages, emails, instant messages, Facebook/Twitter private messages, skype calls and messages, in-game communications as well as web browsing histories for a year and make them available in real time to security services, without a warrant.
The government must drop these plans and any other schemes designed to facilitate mass surveillance without warrant or due process.
